org.latency4j.util

Class ClasspathResourceUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.util.ClasspathResourceUtils

  • public final class ClasspathResourceUtils
extends java.lang.Object

    Utility class for accessing resources on an application's classpath.

    • Field Summary

        public static final java.lang.String CLASSPATH_RESOURCE_PREFIX
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • isClasspathURL

        public static boolean isClasspathURL(java.lang.String candidateString)

        Determines if the specified string is a valid classpath URL of the form "CLASSPATH:"resource-path. Note that this method does not test if the specified does indeed point to a valid resource or if it can be read. It simply tests that the string meets the specifications for a classpath URL.

        Parameters:
        candidateString - The string to test.
        Returns:
        True if the specified string meets the specifications for a classpath URL, and False otherwise.

      • extractPathFromURL

        public static java.lang.String extractPathFromURL(java.lang.String classpathURL)

        Extracts the path portion of the given classpath URL. The path is everything that comes after the "CLASSPATH:" portion of the URL.

        Parameters:
        classpathURL - The URL whose path portion is to be extracted.
        Returns:
        In the case where the URL begins with the prefix, "CLASSPATH:", then everything after the prefix is returned. However, where the URL does not start with the prefix, then the entire URL is returned.

      • openStreamToResource

        public static java.io.InputStream openStreamToResource(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                                       java.lang.Object loader)

        Opens an InputStream which can then be used to read the identified classpath resource. This method works on the assumption that the resource is accessible via the ClassLoader of the specified loader object.

        Parameters:
        resourceName - The classpath resource to which to open a stream.
        loader - The loader object i.e. the object requesting an input stream for reading the resource. It is also possible to simply specify the type/class of the object as the value of this parameter.
        Returns:
        An InputStream to the identified classpath resource.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs creating the resource stream.

      • getClasspathResource

        public static byte[] getClasspathResource(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                          java.lang.Object loader,
                                          int resourceSize)

        Returns the contents of the specified resource as a fixed-size byte array. This method differs from getClasspathResource(String, Object) by the fact that the caller can, in effect, restrict the maximum number of bytes to be read from the resource. Thus if the resource is larger than the specified number of bytes, the results are truncated.

        This method works on the principle that the specified resource is accessible via the ClassLoader of the loading object i.e. the object on whose behalf behalf the resource is being read.

        Parameters:
        resourceName - The name of the resource to be loaded.
        loader - The object requesting the resource. This object's ClassLoader will be used to locate the resource.
        resourceSize - The maximum number of bytes to be read from the resource stream.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the resource data.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs accessing the resource.
        See Also:
        getClasspathResource(String, Object)

      • getClasspathResource

        public static byte[] getClasspathResource(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                          java.lang.Object loader)

        Reads the specified resource from the application's classpath. This method is similar in functionality to getClasspathResource(String, Object, int), except that it will attempt to load the entire resource without regard as to its size.

        Parameters:
        resourceName - The name of the resource to be loaded.
        loader - The object requesting the resource. This object's ClassLoader will be used to locate the resource.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the resource data.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs accessing the resource.
        See Also:
        getClasspathResource(String, Object, int)
